list_definition.definition: able to be seen and felt; real or definite

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A wooden table is a concrete object.

list_definition.definition: a mixture of cement with sand etc used in building

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Since the days of ancient Rome, people have used concrete to build roads, bridges, and buildings.
We’ll have to concrete the garden path.

list_ex_of_english: Any concept that the region will be concreted over for development is wholly misguided.
Everything seems to be spiralling downwards while the north, especially the north-east, is collapsing and the south is being concreted over.
In the following section we will give several concrete examples.
Even to-day local authorities have not been instructed or given authority to have the trenches properly concreted in order to make them permanent.
Let the market decide what can be concreted over and what can then be built.
Before you started to try to do that you would have to put down a properly strengthened and concreted runway.
In peace time the concreted top of this refuge place is used as a car park where 200 cars can be placed.
People want homes in a decent environment with a good quality of life, not with green belt and green fields concreted over.
